en.title: Apprentice Full-Stack Software Developer, Fuelius - Chester
en.text:
Developed full‑stack solutions for prominent clients like Merseyrail and M&S Bank Arena using robust tech stacks including .NET, Razor, C#, React, JavaScript, and CSS/SCSS.

■ Gained hands‑on experience from backend setups to frontend styling, specializing in HubSpot and Umbraco CMS to create responsive, content‑driven websites with a polished user experience.
■ Frequently interacted with clients, managed JIRA tickets, and ensured projects stayed on track.
■ Stepped up to cover senior responsibilities during team members’ leave, demonstrating adaptability and reliability.
■ Committed to writing clean, maintainable code and enhancing site features with AI integrations, including chatbots and blog narration.

en.title: Cloud Engineering and Data Science Bootcamp Participant, The Growth Company - Manchester
en.text:
Completed an intensive bootcamp focused on cloud platforms (AWS, Azure), Python programming, data analysis, and foundational AI.

■ Built practical skills in Python for data analysis and gained familiarity with APIs and data models.
■ Strengthened core knowledge in high‑availability infrastructure and networking through collaborative projects.

en.title: Lifelong Passion for Technology
en.text: From a young age, I was fascinated by computers, game consoles, mobile phones, and every emerging piece of technology. I always had a passion and desire to learn. Some of my fondest tech memories are of a jailbroken original iPod Touch iOS v1.4 with Cydia, downloading custom repos, apps, themes, and so forth. It opened up a whole new world for me, and my only regret in life is not going further down the development rabbit hole sooner. Luckily, I stayed interested in the peripherals, and once I discovered something that made my life make complete sense at 26 (ADHD), I finally pursued my true calling in software development and have the tools in place.

note: For additional education details, please refer to the [education tab](public/data/sections/education.json).
